questions.question: 1. Which of the following spinal nerve roots contribute to the brachial plexus?
2. What is the first segment of the brachial plexus?
3. Which of the following represents the correct sequence of subdivisions in the brachial plexus?
4. Which trunk of the brachial plexus is formed by the union of the C5 and C6 roots?
5. Which nerve is the primary motor nerve to the flexors of the arm?
6. Which cord of the brachial plexus gives rise to the median nerve?
options: Both lateral and medial cords contribute

questions.question: 7. The posterior cord of the brachial plexus gives off which terminal branches?
8. Which nerve originates from the lateral cord and supplies the muscles of the anterior compartment of the arm?
9. Which nerve is formed by contributions from both the lateral and medial cords?
10. Which nerve is responsible for the sensory innervation of the lateral aspect of the forearm?
11. Which trunk of the brachial plexus is formed solely by the C7 root?
12. The lower trunk of the brachial plexus is formed by which roots?
13. Besides the musculocutaneous nerve, what does the lateral cord give rise to?
options: Lateral root of the median nerve
Medial root of the median nerve

questions.question: 14. Which cord of the brachial plexus is situated posteriorly relative to the axillary artery?
15. Which nerve is most commonly injured in a midshaft humeral fracture due to its close relation to the humerus?
16. Which of the following nerves is NOT a terminal branch of the brachial plexus?
17. What is the most common cause of Erb-Duchenne palsy in neonates?
options: Excessive abduction of the arm during delivery
Trauma to the lower trunk of the brachial plexus

questions.question: 18. Which nerve is primarily responsible for the motor innervation of the intrinsic muscles of the hand?
19. Which of the following is a recognized anatomical variation of the brachial plexus?
20. Which nerve injury results in Klumpke's palsy, characterized by a claw hand deformity?
